fabpot.name: Fabien
fabpot.bio: Founder and CEO Blackfire.io, Co-founder SensioLabs, Founder Symfony

pierre.name: Pierre
pierre.about: Pierre Joye is a PHP Core Developer and OSS contributor since more than a decade. He leads the PHP Windows support, main developer from LibGD and works on many OSS projects. After many years as Freelancer, Pierre works now with the Microsoft OpenSource technology Center in Redmond and in Germany.

ocramius.name: Marco
ocramius.bio: Software consultant at Roave. He is part of the Zend Framework team, Doctrine core team

philsturgeon.name: Phil
philsturgeon.bio: Author of "Build APIs You Wont Hate" and engineer at Ride
philsturgeon.about: Phil has contributed to CodeIgniter, FuelPHP, Laravel and handfuls of other projects, to try and make the PHP community a better place. These days he tries to avoid frameworks, but contributes to standards and promotes modern best practices.

paul.name: Paul
paul.about: Paul, a software consultant from Glasgow, Scotland, is a long-term php community member whom spends his time mentoring fellow PHP'ers, contributing to PHP internals, extensions and the php.net website. He is also the lead developer of PPI Framework, where he focuses on framework interoperability and multi-framework co-operation. Since PPI and PHP-FIG share a common goal, he focuses his time maintaining & participating in the PHP-FIG group.

ben.name: Ben
ben.about: 12 year open source PHP eCommerce veteran

samdark.name: Alexander
samdark.bio: Active OpenSource contributor, Yii framework core team member and its representative in php-fig

bastian.name: Bastian
bastian.about: Bastian works as a Software Engineer at ResearchGate, the social network for researchers and scientists. There he is mainly responsible for designing the web frontend's software architecture and caring about performance, monitoring and developer productivity. Before that he created the games and application platform and the APIs of the VZ-networks. When he is not developing stuff, he frequently speaks at international conferences on software architecture, scaling web applications and open standards and protocols.

hannes.name: Hannes
hannes.about: Developer at madewithlove, open source user and contributor, organiser of meetups in Belgium and also a marathon runner

ilukac.name: Ivo
ilukac.bio: Co-founder of Netgen, eZ Publish CMS Specialist and eZ Publish Innovation Board member
ilukac.about: Co-founder of Netgen, Croatian based web company focusing on eZ Publish and Symfony as server side technologies. eZ Publish Innovation Board Member. Frequent speaker on various conferences. Organises eZ Publish Summer Camp (since 2012) and PHP Summer Camp (since 2014). Promotes open source and sharing

fntlnz.name: Lorenzo
fntlnz.about: Lorenzo Fontana is a Software Engineer @ Facile.it . He is passionate about PHP internals and DevOps practices. He's an active member of the Milano PHP User and Milano XP User Group.

apostylee.name: Abdullah
apostylee.bio: Sr. Software Developer at SiberUzay Teknolojileri

akinmoroglu.name: Akın
akinmoroglu.bio: Digital Marketing Manager at Bahcesehir University

birgeelif.name: Birge Elif
birgeelif.bio: COO and Agile Coach of VNGRS, Mother of 35 Developers
birgeelif.about: I'm the Agile Coach of VNGRS, coaching for 4 different development teams. I'm responsible to coaching both team and training Product Owner, removing any kind of impediments throughout development process and increase the productivity of the team. I'm process facilitator, being sure that the team apply agile rules. I'm mentoring Istanbul Team, Agile Sparrow Project of Scrum Turkey.

emirkarsiyakali.name: Emir
emirkarsiyakali.about: Emir Karşıyakalı is Web developer with a passion for open-source, community & PHP. He is Zend Certified PHP Engineer and over 10 years of experience in web application development. Currently working as an independent consultant. User group leader of Istanbul PHP. Organizer of PHPKonf 2014, 2015, Jstanbul 2012, JSIST 2014, Mobilist 2013, PHP-ist 2013, HackING Hackathon 2014 and much more.

emirkarsiyakali.name: Emir
emirkarsiyakali.about: Emir Karşıyakalı is Web developer with a passion for open-source, community & PHP. He is Zend Certified PHP Engineer and over 10 years of experience in web application development. Currently working as an independent consultant. User group leader of Istanbul PHP. Organizer of PHPKonf 2014, 2015, Jstanbul 2012, JSIST 2014, Mobilist 2013, PHP-ist 2013, HackING Hackathon 2014 and much more.

fkadev.name: Fatih Kadir
fkadev.about: Fatih Kadir Akın is a JavaScript Developer. He wrote JavaScript for years, before it was cool. Writing books, organizing events about front-end and JavaScript. Organized the first JavaScript Conference in Turkey: Jstanbul. He is a passioned open-source and community supporter. The "f" in GitHub.

gamze.name: Gamze
gamze.bio: Senior Software Quality Analyst at Hepsiburada.com, TestHive co-organizer

lemi.name: Lemi Orhan
lemi.about: Lemi Orhan Ergin is the managing partner and master software craftsman at ACM. He is a software craftsman, technical leader, development warrior, agile coach and trainer. Prior to his role, Lemi has worked at Sony Europe and eBay Turkey as developer, lead developer, team leader, technical coordinator, team manager, technical architect, solution architect, agile practice lead, principal developer and technical leader for 10 years. He has a lot of hands-on experience in agile methodologies (like Scrum, eXtreme Programming and Kanban), agile transformation, software craftsmanship, lean software development, building agile ALM processes, agile software engineering practices and building a sustainable agile development culture in organizations. He has been working in Scrum teams as Scrum Master, Scrum Team Member and Agile Coach since 2008. He is an active member of Agile Turkey community. He is the community lead of Agile Turkey community and the product owner of the biggest agile conference in Turkey and in the region: Agile Turkey Summit. He is also the founder of Software Craftsmanship Turkey community, i.e. the only Turkish community about Software Craftsmanship. He writes blog posts and shares his knowledge in many different sites. He shares the slides that he presented during the talks on http://www.slideshare.net/lemiorhan. His slides are already viewed more than 600k. He was in the team for translating Agile Manifesto into Turkish. He is the official Turkish translator for Software Craftsmanship Manifesto, SOA Manifesto and Disciplined Agile Manifesto. He meets 5-6 times a year with undergraduates regularly in the events of universities. He is a conference speaker. He already spoke in Google Developer Group (GDG) DevFest Developer Conferences, Dynamics Project Management Congress, Lean Kanban Istanbul, PhpIst14, Voxxed Day Istanbul 2015, Craftsummit15 and tens of seminars and meetups.

mehmetince.name: Mehmet
mehmetince.bio: Senior Penetration Tester at Invictus Europe

mehmetince.name: Mehmet
mehmetince.bio: Senior Penetration Tester at Invictus Europe

muhittin.name: Muhittin
muhittin.about: He has been developing countless of projects with PHP for over 12 years. For last 5 years, he's proud of being one of the rare PHP developers in Izmir, Turkey. Above all, he's most proud of being the father of Zeynep.

nesrin.name: Nesrin
nesrin.bio: Front End Developer at Nomad Commerce
nesrin.about: She started his career as a Front-end Developer. She's currently studying at Kocaeli University and working as a Front-end Developer in Nomad Commerce.

osman.name: Osman
osman.about: Osman 10 yıldan fazladır sistem yöneticiliği deneyimi olan bir yazılım geliştiricidir. Daha çok Java ve PHP yazar. Bunun yanında altyapı tasarımı, sistem otomasyonu, deployment ve sistem izleme görevlerinde de yer almaktadır. Temiz, düzgün kurgulanmış, sürdürülebilir, ölçeklendirilebilir mimarilere önem vermektedir.

vigo.name: Uğur
vigo.bio: Head of Web Applications Development Dep. at Istanbul Bilgi University
vigo.about: “vigo” is an old-skool software developer who still loves and operates Commodore 64 and Amiga computers. Also he loves Ruby, GIT, Python and UNIX stuff very much!
